newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Bahrain's share trading drops in week, index slips.
newsitem.headline: Bahrain's share trading drops in week, index slips.

text.p: Bahrain's official share index fell 2.12 points as trading volume dropped sharply, the Bahrain Stock Exchange (BSE) said.
It said the index slipped to 1,546.03 points in the week ending on Thursday from 1,548.15 points the previous week.
The trading volume retreated to 2.9 million shares worth 1.1 million dinars ($2.9 million) this week from 18 million shares worth 3.36 million dinars a week earlier.
Shares of 23 firms out of 39 registered at the bourse were traded in 121 transactions, the bourse said.
The bourse said Investcorp led the market with 753,949 shares worth 525,839 dinars traded, followed by Bahrain Telecommunications Company with 745,333 shares worth 309,053 dinars changing hands.
Bahrain's bourse is open to nationals in Gulf Arab states -- Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Qatar, Oman, Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates. Some firms are also open to foreign investors.
